a voluntary compliance system for monitoring coffee imports under quotas is viewed skeptically by many in the coffee industry sadi analysts and trade sources

many sectors of the trade including large roasters and importers are adamant against voluntary compliance because of the past which was subject to tremendous irregularities as it became a matter of the trade monitoring each other one analyst sadi

on monday a national coffee association newsletter said the office of trade representative will implement a voluntary compliance system temproarily because legislation to monitor imports is tied up in the congressional trade bill

under the arrangement milar to one in 9180 coffee importers would voluntarily present needed documents to the government until congress approves the monitoring authority but if coffee arrives without valid certification it will still be allowed entry

while many believe producers will not seek ot add to the overburdened stock situation in the others believe some will ship outside of the quota requirements in lieu of monitoring controls trade sources said
last time there aws a lot of false information submitted to customs which resulted in a lot of indictments and fines a customs spokesman said
customs can do a good job when given the tools but when its hands are tied it does have the authority to demand form o documents tracking merchandise from source ot destination he said
many see it as a true test of whether producers and importers will abide by teh quota system
it si a key to seeing whether there are any teeth in the quota agreement said one major roaster
last time ew had a gentleman agreement the trade did not act as a gentleman said another analyst adding without the need to submit documents the ball will be in the producers hands
some feel that ipmorters will take advantage of the voluntary compliance due to development of a market in which countries buy coffee at a big discount
many fear that edalers will buy coffee destined for countries at discounts and then bring it into the falsely labelled

according to customs officials several green coffee importers confessed in 1985 that they had imported coffee fraudulently after buying it for destinations forging landing certificates and thne relabelling it as navy beans

if there that much of a discrepancy between prices for one country and another producers may be teted to get rid of their stocks of coffee by selling to nations and by circumventing the quota provisions sadi paine webber analyst bernie savaiko
still others believe that producers will not eb hard pressed to aggravate the overburdened coffee stock situation in the in the near term

it would be naive to suggest that any agreement would not have some share fo connivance but i think the voluntary system seemed to suffice and coupled with the fact that we have so much coffee i do think that it poses that much of a threat one trader said

the european community ec agreed a trade deal with argentina designed to compensate the country following the entry of spain adn portugal into the group ec officials said
under the deal agreed by ec foreign ministers argentina will gain additional trading rights on a series of products including meta fish and cereals
but ministers failed to agree on new trade deals with canada adn japan and are due to study these again the officials said
the deal with argentina was agreed by a majority of ec sttaes after west germany withdrew objections to increased quotas for argentina on beef
ireland and france continued to oppose the deal on meat saying that the main dispute was over sales of cereals substitutes but they were outvotde by the other states the officials said
under the deal argentina will benefit from improved quotas on exports of befe to the ec
in particular the quota on hilton beef will be raised by tonnes to tonnes and quotas on frozen boneless befe will be increased by tonnes to tonnes
argentina will also benefit from an additional quota of tonnes of frzoen hake fillets at 10 pct duty and reduced levies on tonnes of wheat bran the officials said
the improved trade terms were offered after argentina said that spain adn portugal entry into the ec affected their exports of cereals substitutes to these two countries
they have been negotiated under teh rules of gatt general agreement on tariffs and trade
but officials said ministers had been unable to resolve canadian claims that its sales of certain fihs to spain had been affected by the country ec membership
officials said the ec had asked gatt to arbitraet on the fish dispute with canada
ministers also decided to continue talsk with japan
the ec claims that spain and portugal etnry into the group has improved trade conditions for japan but has been unsatisfied with japanese offers of compensation

japan main offers were to improve inspection systems on citrus fruits to aid ec exports to improve tariffs for some other farm produce to increase tariffs for leather footwear and to offer better trade terms for spani and portugal

cascading global stock prices are evoking grim memories of the great mraket crash of 1929 but analysts are reminding investors of safeguards in place before they stash their savings under the mattress
but some also say that while banking securities and social laws written during the great depression should prevetn a repeat of that dismal era more protection still might have to be considered
and analysts caution that while new laws can deal with some problems lawmakers ca legislate away fear whcih helped drive the new york stock exchange to its record dow jones index loss on monday
that percent loss nearly doubled the oct 29 9129 loss of percent
on the day before that year the market efll nearly 13 per cent
in a series of reuters interviews with government congressional and private analysts most agreed safeguards exist ot avoid a repeat of 1929 and its depression aftermath
charles schultze chairman of the president council of economic advisers under jimmy carter said in an interview that the safeguards should be adequate to avodi a repeat of 1929 to 1933
the safeguards are fine he said teh safeguards are adequate to prevent a cascading liquidity failure
that not the overall problem which is the dollar and trade defciits
schultze now with the brookings institution pointed to a weak federal reserve during the 1920s when the fed acted in the wrong way in 1929 ti tightened money
similarly president reagan budget manager james miller told reuters the safeguards in place should be adequaet
and millionaire oilman and business takeover specialist boone pickens said the present safeguards should avoid ayn 1929 situation
ti is a much more sophisticated system i do see that a comparison is valid
marvin oksters director of economic policy studies at the conservative american enterprise institute thinks the present safeguards will work
the amin thing is the understanding of the federal reserve of its responsibility to maintain liquidity in the economy he said
there is no raeson why this market fall needs to spread into the real economy
maybe ti better it happened at all
rex hardesty of the huge labor confederation siad many of the present safeguards are not working saying only of the unemployed are now receiving benefits
he also called for an increase in hte dlr minimum wage which has not been raised since 1981
one of the main things taht appears different in 1987 than in 1929 is market psychology analysts point out
during those anything goes days fo flappers and bathtub gin the stock market was the road to riches that captured the savings of shoeshine boys to bank presidents
it was veiwed as a highway to heaven with no turning back
but happy days soon collapsed into a nationwide hysterical panic with the stock market crash wiping out paper millions and losing the life savings of mayn average investors as panic set in
brokers leaped from wall street skyscrapers
american banks closed for a holiday in 1933 as depositors clamored to pull out their savings
the great depression followed leading into wordl war ii
images of those days surfaced with the unprecedented sell off on monday but analysts maintained times are different
house banking committee specialist jake lewis said that bank investors should have no fears because their savings are now completely backed by the govenrment
even though there have been record bank failures 145 last year 148 this year through today everyone received their savings unlike the millions lost when banks collapsed 60 years aog
banking deposits then uninsured now are fully insured yb the government up to dlrs for each saver

as the depression swept the nation president franklin roosevelt steered into law sweeping bnaking and securities reforms to deal with many of the problems that led to the crash and hurt people afterwards

european community ec agriculture ministers gave their support in principle for a new scheme ot limit spending on the bloc controversial farm policy at a meeting in luxembourg on tuesday danish minister laurits tornaes told journalists

britain has said it will block moves to give the ec additional sources of finance unless a detailed system of stabilisers is agreed at or ahead of the smumit

under the most important stabiliser scheme ec guaranteed pirces for cereals would be cut by one percentage point for every per cent by which the annual harvest exceeded 155 mln tonnes a figure well below what ec farmers are capable of producing in a year of favourable weather conditions

federal reserve board governor robert heller said the banking system could be strengthened by permitting formation of financial services holding companies involvde in areas like banking insurance real estate and securities

in a speech prepared for delivery in new york to the bank and financial analysts association heller said i believe that increased diversification along geographic and product linse is the key to strengthening the american banking system

he said he supported the idea of financial services holding companies advocated by the association of bank holding companies in which regultaion of various bank thrift insurance investment securities and real estate subsidiaries would be handled on functional lines
limits would be placed on the extension of credit by the bank to the associated instituitons and all transactions would have to be on an basis heller said
measures would be necessary to avoid abuse of the special position by such holding companies ro subsidiaries
heller said he would require the holding company to serve as a of strength to teh bank by making a commitment to maintain the bank capital
in toher words the bank would not be allowed to fail as long as the holding company has a positive net worth
heller also said commercial enterprises should be permitted to own a financial services holding company again with the provision that capital would flow to the financial enterprise if encessary

heller said the fefects of these actions would be banks that are at least as strong as the corporations holding them in which customer deposits were assured while any incentive to loot the bank was removed
such diversification would give access to national and international finacnial services to corporations across the united states
heller said that would mean the steady decline of banks in the world financial league tables would be arrested by permitting thme to become more competitive

international business machines corp ibm is widely expected to deeply affect the personal computer industry this week when it announces a long awaited new generation fo desktop machines

the four new computers expected to be called the personal system 2 family are almost srue to veer away from industrywide standards for personal computers that were first established by ibm six years ago
the result id the new computers will be harder to copy and less likely to work with software and attachments designed for existing standards
some market researchers are already predicting sloewr growth as customers adjust to the change

a proprietary ibm pc will cause the pc market growth to eb flat or even negative in 1988 as vendors and users delay purchases to gauge the importance of the new machine said john mccarthy consultant with forrester research ibm is traditionally very about unannounced products but so intense is the interest in these machines that some details have leaked out and consultants dealers and the trade press are rife with information both factual or supposed

the four computers expected to eb announced april 2 will reportedly include one low end low cost computer two models that will resemble ibm current at and most importantly a computer incorporating intel corp intc 80386 microprocessor the powerhouse chip that is revolutionizing the personal computer
the microprocessor is the brains of a computer and intel microprocessors are the ones used in all ibm and personal computers by far the largest segment of the desktop marekt

the 80386 more commonly called the 386 processes computer instructions twice as fast as the chips used in existing ibm computers and desktop computers are as powerful as the muhc larger minicomputers of a few years ago

although ibm will not be the first company to introduce a 386 personal computer compaq corp cpq was most industry consultants believe that customers will not rush to embrace the new generation until tehy see what the world largest computer company is going to do
what ibm will apparently do is introduce a computer that is at leats temporarily
that is a far different situation than exists with ibm current family of personal computers which aer cloned widely

with the personal system ibm will reportedly build as many features as possible directly into the motherboards including graphics capabilities a bus for equipment and a new verison of the operating system used on all ibm compatible computers
the word in silicon valley is that it will take two mln dlrs and 18 months before the machines can be copied said michael murphy publisher of teh newsletter california technology stock letter

at the same time as personal system is unveiled microsoft corp msft is expected to unveil a new version of its operating system dos that will corerct many of the programming problems encountered on earlier versions of the software
is used with all ibm personal computers
consultants said that most existing software will run on the new computers but softwaer written specifically for the personal system will not run on older models

the industry will be looking closely at the delivery dates for the new computers particularly the 386 because if ibm does not start shippnig its entry in this important new market soon compaq will continue to gain larger and larger market share

sri lanka has appealed ot 24 countries for emergency aid to help mln villagers affected by the country worst drought in 36 years government officials said
embassies received letters over hte weekend outlining aid needed for a sixth of sri lanka population in 13 districts

the letter said the government had to step ni to avert serious economic hardship and because the social services ministry had already used up its entire 1987 budget provision of 23 mln rupees by distributing help to the worst hit areas
the letter said mln rupees were needed for a six month period at least until the yala rice crop was harvested
over tonnes of wheat rice flour nad other cereals were required it said along with supplies of sugar lentils dried or canned fish and milk

maha paddy output was now estimated at 70 mln buhsels 20 mln less than originally expected
there were two scenarios for the yala crop with a high forecsat of around 40 mln bushels conditional on adequate rainfall within the next three to four weeks
should the present drought continue however production is estimated at around 02 mln bushels the letter added
total estimated paddy output for 1987 would be between 90 and 101 mln bushels or to mln tonnes of rice
last year output was 124 mnl bushels down from 127 mln in 1985
the letter said villagers in most seriously affected districts had been deprievd of any means of subsistence because subsidiary crops had also failed
it said the government current budget did not permit it to prvoide sustained and adequate relief to those affected
revenue has been adversely affected yb depressed commodity prices and slowing of the economy
defence commitments continue to exert pressrue on the expenditure side
the mln cash would cover payments of 150 ruepes per month for each family as well as handling transport and distribution of emergency food
but such an outlay of funds by the govenrment would not be possible without seriously impairing development projects or greatly fuelling inflation in the economy the letter said
the letter said the food department would be abel to release wheat and rice from the buffer stock to meet the immediate cereal requirements provided such stocks are replaced subsequently
the meteorological department asid the country was experiencing its worst drought since 1951 and the dry spell prevailing in most of the areas would only break when the monsoon rains fell in late may
the eltter said some areas had been experiencing the drought since august and in the rice growing district of kurunegala there had been no effective rainfall since june 1986

the international primary market makers association a trade organisation said its board last week adopted new rules recommending lead managers of eurodollar bond issues make a market in that security for 21 months
currently while there is an ipmlied obligation on the part of firms to make markets in issues they underwrite there is no formal obligation to do so
christopher sibson secretary general of impa in explaining why the recommendation was adopted said it is aimed at the problem of the lead manager who does a deal and disappears
sibson said hte organization can not force its members to adhere to the rule
we nuder no illusions about the legal binding force of these recommendations he said

lead managers have occasionally abandoned efforts to uspport an unprofitable issue just a short while after it has been offered leaving investors and smaller firms with no one to buy it back from them

most recently when prices of perpetual floating artes notes frns suddenly plunged most market makers abandoned the securities altogether leaving investors stuck with about 17 billion dlrs worth of unmarketable securities on their books
sibson noted that the recommendation adopted by the board only applies to dollar issues and would not have helped the flaoting rate sector out of its current crisis
among other measures the ipma also decided that the criteria for membership should be tightened to exclude some of the smallre firms

under the new rules a firm must be the book running lead manager during the two preceding years of 12 internationally distributed debt issues denominated in dlrs or in one of eight other major currencise
the fromer requirement called for three issues
sibson said he expects the tighter entrance reqiurements to pare 3he current list of 67 members down by six to 10 members
smaller firms have criticized ipma efforts to resrtict membership to the larger firms saying it is and that it reinforces the big firms already large market share
eblonging to ipma carries a certain amount of prestige with borrowers said a dealer at a small foreign bank
hte borrower says to himself well i can travel economy or i can travel first class he said
isbson defended the new rules saying we have to steer a course between representing the interests of the major market makers and the less desirable goal of representing everybody
in any event he said the size fo the market has expanded to the point where the former minimum size requirements were just too small
also ipma members will be required to register with the association of international bond dealers as reporting dealers submitting daily information on prices on issues in which tehy are market makers
the effective date fo the rule has yet to be determined
dealers said that the rule would enable invsetors and secondary market makers to better evaluate the appropriate market price for their securities
such a rule would make investors more confident of trading ni the eurobond market and would increase liquidity they said
dealers said that the form of the reporting has not yet bene spelled out
but previous discussion of the reporting requirement considered firms listing the closing price of a given security as well as the high and lwo for the day

members also agreed at the ipma meeting on the implementation of a new communications system which enablse a lead manager to invite all potential management group members in to a deal at the same time

the brazilian coffee institute ibc is expceted to maintain its previous pricing system when it reopens export registrations probably later this week exporters said

they said ibc president jorio dauster is likely to leave the basic formula ofr the minimum registration price unchanged but raise the contribution quota to partially offset the effects of cruzado devaluation since april registrations were closed in
to uflly compensate for devaluation the quota would have to be around 28 dlrs per bag against when registrations closed
however even a 21 dlr per bag rise in the contribution quota would make brazil coffees uncompetitive on world marktes and an increase to around 15 dlrs a bag is more likely the exporters said
they added that dauster is keen to raise the contribution quota as the institute needs money to repya central governmnet funds released to finance ibc purchases at the guaranteed producer price
although a vote in the monetary council to provide more funds for such purchases was deferred on technicla grounds last week funds are still being released for subsequent approval
the sources said it is still unclear when registrations will be reopened although most expcet it to be by the end of this week
brazil owes it to its customers to maek its intentions know
a country like brazil can not afford to be permanently closed down oen exporter said

however before announcing its export policy the ibc si likely to wait to see if tomorrow meeting of the international coffee organisation ico executive board in london decides to call a full council meeting to discuss reintroduction of export quotas sources said
there is also talk fo the announcement this week of new measures to adjust the brazilian economy and the ibc could be awaiting clarification before making any move the exporters said

another factor which could be delaying the opening fo registrations is the current strike by bank workers which while not affecting current shipments could affect documentation and currency operations for new sales
this would certainly be the case if the ibc was considering obliging exporters ot pay the contribution quota within two or three days of registering a sale

french rpime minister jacques chirac called on leading western nations to set up a mechanism which would put a stop to volatile foreign exchange rates
in a speech prepared for delivery to businessmen and bankers in new york chirac said said monetary stablility was a key element in bringing the world ifnancial system back to health
the industrialized states should agree to set up a monetary framework which would provide the necessary stability as well as sufficient flexibility to allow ajustments when eneded chirac said
this requires a monitoring and alert mechanism which would permit a timely adn concerted reaction he said
the prime minister on the first day of a visit to the united states said the february 22 paris accords agreed by the group of fiev industrial nations should serve as a basis for the new mechanism
under the paris accords the united states britain france west germany and japna agreed to stabilize exchange rates around existing parities

uerope is very sensitive to every rumour of protectionism

investors who have been riding the bull market in stocks got a stinging reminder today of how unexpected news cna trigger sharp reversals

chancellor of the exchequer nigel lawson said the meeting of six mjaor industrial nations in paris last month agreed not to publish any bands in connection with their pact to stabilise currencies
questioned by a parliamentary select committee about why the participating countries had not announced any bands lawson replied we all agreed it would be much more sensible not to

when asked whether that meant an informal joint currency float with set ranges aws arranged in paris lawson said i do not want to reveal the precise nature of the agreement so as not to make it easy for speculation against the accord
lawson said the paris accord presumed taht individual countries would take corrective action if their currency began reacting significantly to domestic macroeconomic factors
but if such movements were due ot extraneous factors lawson said the other pact countries would come to its aid through concerted intervention on the foreign exchanges

it is clear that both germany and ajpan are having difficulty adjusting to their very large exchange rate appreciations and making their economies more domestically oriented just as it is taking time for the united states to make its own economy more export oriented lawson said
in his oral evidence to parliament select terasury committee lawson repeated that he was happy with the current level adding that it is an objective to try to keep it around that level
he said the perception fo sterling on foreign exchanges had changed since the steep drop in oil prices largely because the pound had weathered that period so successfully
there has been a reassessment of sterling fundamentals lawson said
he disagreed with what eh termed the grossly exaggerated claim that real interest rates were much higher than those of other major industrialsed countries

using as a reference the key sterling interbank rate sa quoted in london lawson said britain now had a real interest rate level of pct the same as japan did and only a percentaage point above the group of five average
lawson confirmed that over the medium and longer term the government obejctive is zero inflation
he said the government intention of its pbsr constant at pct of gdp is the modern equivalent of the balanced budget doctrine
he added that to allow the ratio ot remain constant on anything other than zero inflation basis is simply a recipe for accelerating inflation

up to 70 pct of the 240 finance companies operating in sweden are likely to be squeezed out over the netx few years by the deregulation of financial markets the association of swedish finance companies said
association chairman arne ogren told a news conference that a maojr restructuring of the sector was inevitable

central bank governor bengt dennis said when announcing the deregulation in november 1985 that one of his main aims was ot give commercial banks a chance to compete on equal terms with finance companies and so undermine sweden grey market
total credit granted by the swedish finance companies rose ot 77 billion crowns in 1986 from billion in 1985
this includes leasing and is the equivalent of 19 pct of all outstanding loasn by the banking sector at

ogren said that if proposals now being discussed by a inquiry into the credit market to license finance companies and make them increase their share capital weer pushed through up to 70 pct would disappear
but he said this would in fact have little effect on credit volumes sa the 42 biggest finance companies accounted for 70 pct of lending by the entire sector

the explosive growth of swedish finance companies began in the early 1970s and commercial banks even started their own to get around the tight restrictions then imposed on banking activities and particulalry on the growth of lending
now that they were on an equal footing with their parent companies many finance companies faced an identity crisis ogrne said
he predicted there would be mergers nad individual firms would carve out specialised niches to ensure their survival in a deregulated climate
ogren said the sector losses on abd loans were bound to rise steeply in due to the rush to increase credit

computer makers that use teh chips in their machines will then be pressured
the japanese are looking for ways to reduce trdae pressures from washington but at the same time demonstating their muscle analyst peck said
the cut backs in japanese production are expected to benefit hcip makers
i think this could be a very important factor for semiconductor manufacturers industry analyst elliot levine of ladenburg thalmann co asid
but analyst peck asid it will take a few weeks to see whether japan has genuinely cut production

the use of generic commodity certificates or certs for fiscal years will save the government 50 to 100 mnl dlrs department of agriculture undersecretary daniel amstutz said

speaking at a house agriculture subcommittee hearing on the use of the certificates amstutz said that the issuance of billion dlrs of certificates during fiscal years could result in government outlays of up to 400 mln dlsr
however the use of certificates preclude the need for 450 to 500 mln dlrs in storage and handling cosst resulting in net savings for the government of mln dlrs he said
without the use of certificates amstutz said nearly teh entire 1985 crop which had been put under loan would have been forfeited to the commodity credit corporation ccc
in addition 260 mln bushels of grain that haev been redeemed from ccc inventory through certificate exchanges would have remained in the goverment inventory he said

when asked to comment on a recent study by the general accounting office that concluded certificates result ni a net cost to the government amstutz said gao underestimated the benefits and overstated the costs of the certificate program
amstutz siad while certificates encourage more loan entries they also encourage heavier loan redemptions rather than forfeitures
goa underestimated this net loan activity amstutz said
there is no question in the mind of the department of agriculture that these certificates have been very useflu amstutz said
immediate benefits of certificates include greater market liquidity improved market price competitiveness higher farm income and improved debt istuation and decreased carrying costs he said
certificates are an integral part of usda farm policy he siad
amstutz told subcommittee chairman dan glickman that usda is in the process of preparing an official response to the gao study on certificates and will submit it to the subcommittee when completed

more generic grain certificates should be released onto the market in oredr for the certificate program to have its full effect on commodities according to a study by sparks commodities inc

the agriculture department should make grain deficiency payments and paid land diversion payments in a certificate cash ratio through fiscal year 1989 carroll brunthaver president of sparks commodities told a house agriculture subcommittee hearing on certificates
thereafter government payments should be issued in roughly a split between acsh and certificates brunthaver said

the psarks study on certificates examined two possible scenarios through the 1990 growing season a zero certificate case where no certificate program was assumed and an alternative case labeled adequate certificate case in which sufficient certificates would be released so that grain prices would not be artificially supported by market shortages due to acreage reduction programs or government holdings
hte study showed that total grain use under the adequate certificate scenario would exceed the zero certificate scenario by pct
suage would be markedly more in 1989 and 1990 when grain usage under a certificate program was estimated to exceed the zero certificate case by 15 to 19 pct
ofr the period examined government expenditures under the adequate certificate case were billion dlrs or pct less than under the zero certificate case
hte sparks study said that billion dlrs or 70 pct of those savings resulted from smaller government storage costs
the study also etsimated that government grain stocks under the adequate certificate case would be billion bushels below the zero certificate case at the end of the period examined
the sparks study asid that while certificates permit market prices to fall below loan levels these lower prices increase commodity usage and reduce the net costs of certificates versus cash

the executive committee of the italian national banking association abi representing the mjaor credit institutions approved the setting up of a common reserve fund to guarantee customer deposits in the event of bank failures

abi chairman giannino parravicini told a news conference that the fund would ont be operative until the latter part of 1987 and only on condition that 60 pct of banks representing at least 75 pct of total deposits participated
he said the fund would initially have billion lire available and would cover deposits fo up to three billion lire
a statute for establishing a deposit guarantee fund has alerady been approved by the bank of italy and by an interministerial committee on credit and savings
the billion lire initial funding which will be provided thorugh contributions from banks which opt to join the scheme compares with an originally targetted figure of billion lire
parravicini said the fund would be gradually increased to billion lire by end 1991 and that the decision to achieve this figure gradually rather than immediately was due to fiscal considerations

the fund still to be formally ratified by abi steering committee will provide 100 pct coverage on deposits of up to 200 mln lire 90 pct on deposits between 200 mln and one billion lire and 80 pct on thoes between one billion and three billion lire
assuming that all banks join the fund contributions woudl be equivalent to around pt of a bank total deposits

trade representative lcayton yeutter said that if congress were to require trade retaliation it would only close markets and would result in less trade

in remarks prepared for an address to members of the university of chicago graduate school of business yeutter said many congressional proposals do not appear to be overtly protectionist yet their undeniable effect would be to close off market opportunitites just as exchange rate movement is unleashing such opportunities for teh first time in several years

despite all our progress on trade policy and despite the president comprehensive competitiveness initiaitve there are many in congress who still are supporting trade bills containing many dangerous provisions yuetter said
yeutter said many countries would prefer retalitaion to opening their own markets
we should be intelligent enough to not let them off the hook that easliy he said
he said that tough but flexible legislative language is infinitely preferable to tough btu inflexible language
both house and senate trade propoasls place undesirable limits on presidential discretion he said
limiting the president ability to consider all available options on issues sa sensitive as these would be most unwise yeutter said
that could readily provoke retaliation which would unneccesarily embroil us in trdae wars injuring most competitive export industries
yeutter said persent trade laws are fundamentally sound
president reagan has threatened ro implemented retaliation eight times in the last 18 months most recently in the case of japanese semiconductors being dumped in world markets

he took these steps as a last resort only atfer carefully analyzing all the contingencies on a case by case basis and only after determining that such actions would open markets to american exports he said
yeutter said it would be foolish to attempt ot solve the trade deficit by focusing on trade policy alone
he added that the trade deficit was created primraily by macroeconomic policy shortcomings here and abroad

brazil has set pu a special debt commission headed by finance minister dilson funaro to be responsible for renegotiating brazil 109 billion dollar foreign debt officials said
the principal negotiator no the commission created by president jose sarney will be former foreign minister ramiro saraiva guerreiro
officials said guerreiro would be joined on the commission by eight senior officials including a representative of teh national security council
the creation of the commission is intended to underscore the brazilian government contention that the debt issue si essentially political and that a political solution must be found to the problem
on february 20 brazil suspended interest payments on its 68 billion dollar foreign bank debt to try ot force the issue
rceditor banks however have signalled that they are equally determined to resist brazil demands for debt relief
eysterday funaro travelled to the united states for fresh debt negotiations with creditors deeply angered by suspension of interest payments
funaro was due to hold talks in new york today with the private sector before travelling to washington for the annual meeting of teh international monetary fund and the world bank
officials said the new commission would start wrok in earnest when funaro returns from the united states
yesterday funaro called ofr a new forum for discussion of the foreign debt
he suggested direct paritcipation of the governments of creditor countries in debt talks
in negotiations on comemrcial debt talks have traditionally been restricted to banks
the creation of the enw commission brings brazil highly professional foreign ministry much more into the forefront on the debt issue than it has been in the past
during the period of miiltary rule which ended in 1985 the foreign ministry played a very minor role in debt policy
but hte new commission has diplomats among its members and the chief negotiator saraiva guerreiro is a seasoned envoy with a long diplomatic career

brazil financial crisis is rapidly beocming a political and social crisis and president jose sarney faces increasingly serious questions about his future
as brazil enters debt tlaks with creditors in the united states this week political analysts say administration has never appeared weaker
the full political price wihch sarney will have to pay for the failure of the cruzado plan is still not clear
he might hvae to pay with the presidency
calls are increasing for direct presidential elections ot pick a successor to sarney early next year
the length of his term will be dceided by a constituent assembly and sarney has been lobbying for a term
sarney came to power without facing presidential eletcions in march 1985 when the military bowed out after 21 years of rule
although there was wide public support for direct elections for president the military as noe of their last acts insisted an electoral college where it felt it had more influence make the choice
the college chose tancredo neves a popular politician who headed the brazilian democratic movement party pmbd which had opposed military rule
in part to smooth relations with the military neves chose sarney a supporter of the generasl for the purely ceremonial post of
but neves died before he could take offcie and sarney took power
he won the grudging support of the pmdb and the cruzado plan was wildly popular iwth brazilians
but hte cruzado plan failed and politics in brazil has not been the same
the ocuntry is a rudderless ship said a
diplomat echoing a common view that the government lacks any claer idea of how to tackle the economic crisis
sarney has appeared increasingly isolated with criticism coming from the businses community the trade unions some of the military the media and political opponents
many businessmen are unhappy with sarney decision announced on february 02 to suspend interest payments on 68 billion dlrs of foreign debt
a motor industry executive said teh business community thinks brazil should go to the imf
their rules are sometimes harsh and strict but this is the only way to put the house in ordre
trade unions generally support the debt moratorium but disagree wiht other aspects of government policy
since the end of february they have organized national strikes of seamen bankworkers and federal university teachers and countless local stoppages and protests
economic problems have prompted criticism from some military figures including the last army ruler general jooa figueiredo
it is a sign of the times that almost daily military men deny there is goign to be a coup
if the army does stay in the barracks the key arbitors of sarney fate will eb the pmdb leaders
so far they have not taken a clera stand on the issue of direct elections
but one pmdb leader senator affonso camargo pointedly said yesterday that it was the sovereign rigth of the consituent assembly to call direct elections for the presidency whenever it wished
ni the media sarney has to contend with strong criticism

one senior political commentator fernando pedreira of the jornal do brasil wrote in the newspaper last week president sarney is a man of good intentions but it is just possible that he himself is not aware of the true state of the country and the people since the immense failure of the cruzado lpan
hte disappointment the frustration the irritation the enticement have been and continue to be too great too profound
he called for direct elections early in 1898 as the only way out of the present crisis
one of sao paulo leading news magazines snehor said in an editorial this week the government of president jose sarney has failed
two years have arleady been too long for such a disastrous experience
it deserves to eb buried as quickly as possible
the ntaural solution direct elections soon
the government inability ot control inflation is now bringing with it serious social problems
an explosion in rents in sao paulo has thrown tens of thousands fo families onto the streets because they can no longer afford to pay even for a wooden shack in the slums
the local press says the city si experiencing the biggest wave of land invasions in its history
according to rental agencies rents have increased 500 pct in little moer than a year
even the cheapest shacks now cost cruzados 90 dollars a month half as much again as the minimum wage which is all thta many earn

the state of texas fcaed with a record billion dlr budget deficit over the next two years may have to consider introducing income tax economic analysts said
such a possibility was unthinkable a few years back when the state enomrous wealth from oil and gas revenues easily allowed texans the luxury of paying no personal or corporate income tax
however last year dramatic slump in oil prices not only sent the texas economy into a tailspin but cut heavliy into the state tax revenues
both moody investor services and stnadard and poor cut their credit ratings of the state to double a from the top triple a in early march

moody vice president george leung said it was the first time txeas rating had been lowered since 1962 adding the report noted that while the legislature is now considering proposals to restore budget balance medium term prospects for full recovery are weak

with only a slight improvement in the economy seen by state comptroller bob bullock the texas legislature must grapple with a one billion dlr deficit yb august 31 and another billion dlr deficit by the end of the next biennium
no other state in history has facde such a deficit

there is a strong independent streak in texans and five years ago i would nveer have dreamed the state legislature would institute an income tax said george bland assistant professor of political science at north texas state university adding now my contacts at the legislature tell me coming it inevitable it only a matter of time
state taxes on oil and gas production traidtionally supplied as much as a third of the state revenues
however that source has fallen to about 51 pct in recent years and with last year price slump the state dependence on sales taxes is approaching 50 pct
bland said he believes the tax reform act will be a major factor in the state decision because under it sales taxes are no longer deductible from fedreal income tax while state income tax is

john kennedy senior research associate at the texas research league said there is a great deal of popular sentiment against it plus the first plank of governor clemenst platform was no tax increases let alone a new tax
however he said that since the oil price fall the state faecd a choice of either instituting an income tax or broadening and possibly raising the sales tax

steve pejovich director of the center for free enterprise at texas a and m university and an opponent of income taxes said eh favored reforming the present tax system to take account of the changed structure of the economy
we should rely less on traditional sources such as oil and agricluture and real estate and more on service industries manufacturing and pejovich said

tony proffitt an aide to state comptroller bob bullock said bullock si opposed to an income tax but has warned the legislature that if they get tired of looking at everything else that the only option

apart from texas states which have no individual income tax are alaska florida nevada new hampshire south dakota washington and wyoming for the time being attornye general jim mattox has ruled that the legislature may carry over the current one billion dlr deficit into the next biennium even though the state consitution requires a balanced budget
but as state treasurer ann richards said last thursday jim mattox decision today turns the heat down on the presusre cooker but we must not think that the goose is still cooking
opponents to new or hihger taxes argue in favor of spending cuts
but the state is already under pressure from a federal district court to clean up its overcrowded prison system or face 24 mln dlrs a month in fiens
and education secretary william bennett has accused the state among others of lxa education reform
earlier this year both houses of the legislature citing financial restraints as well as teacher morale passed bills abandoning plans to require teachers to taek competency tests
bland said he believes the state will set up a commission next year to study alternative revenue sources with an income tax being instituted sa early as january 1989
if the political leaders are educated about the effects of the tax reform atc i think there will be a gradual drift toward income tax he said

bundesbank president karl otto poehl said a weaker dollar would eb risky and a further appreciation of the mark would damage prospects for sustained west german economic growth

in a pseech to the institute of contempory german affairs here poehl said it would be an extremely risky policy to aim for a further substantial decline in the value of the dollar to correct the trade deficit
he asid the united states could face a vicious circle of depreciation inflation and more depreciation if it took that route
opehl noted west germany had already taken steps to meet
demands ofr greater stimulation of its domestic economy accelerating tax cuts cutting interest rates and tolerating money supply growth

he said he would have been happy to have brought forward five billion marks of tax cuts now planned for january 1988 to the beginning of this year but he said the government faced political constraints getting suhc measures through the upper house of the west german parliament

poehl said west germany relied on exports for about of its gross nationla product so a substantial erosion of export markets could not be offset by increasing demand at home

poehl said the bundesbank had tolerated rapid money supply growth last year because the country enjoyed low inflation and because external factors including low oil priecs and favourable terms of trade had given some extra leeway

the underlying rate of inflation was now two pct nto the reported negative inflation rates last year and west germany was affected more than before by exchange rate developments

bundesbank president karl otto poehl said a weaker dollar would be risky adn a further appreciation of the mark would damage prospects for sustained west german economic growth

in a speech to the institute of contempory german affairs here poehl said it would be an extremely risky policy to aim for a further substantial decline in the value of the dollar to correct the trade deficit

demands for greater stimulation fo its domestic economy accelerating tax cuts cutting interest rates and tolerating money supply growth

senate banking committee chairman william proxmire said he planned to introduce legisaltion shortly to require greater public disclosure of corporate takeovers and fairer treatment for all shareholders
speaking to the national association of manufacturers proxmire said recent insider trdaing stock scandals increased the chance that congress will act to curb abuses
we are proposing legislation that would provide for more disclosure would be fairer to all shareholders and would insure that tkaeovers are properly financed he said

among the provisions the bill would reduce the threshold for notifying the securities and exchange commission that a investor or group has acquired a percentage of stock in a company to three pct from the current five pct threshold within 01 days proxmire said
in addition there would be a requirement that an investor intended to aquire three pct that would have to filed iwth the sec
proxmire said the requirement was meant to prevetn arbitragers from having a jump on the general public in knowing about coming takeover attempts
proxmire said he would call for extending the period that a tender offer must be kept open under the williams act to 60 business days from the current 20 business dyas
his bill would provide for pirvate suits if the acquiring company violated the time period on the tender offer
to correct abuses in the financing of takeovers proxmire said the legislation would aim at insuring current margni requirments are properly enforced
the federal reserve board has a 50 pct margin requirement for purchasing stock but proxmire said it si not generally enforced in hostile takeovers
rather the groups or individuals leading a takeover declare that thye can raise the capital for a takeover without actually putting any of their own money proxmire said
he said his bill would allow private suits for damages fro failure to meet the federal reserve 50 pct margin requirements
the bill also would require more disclose when several investors fomr an alliance in a hostile takeover
when pickens and icahn get togetehr we want people to know about it proxmire said
proxmire said he favored the aprpoach used in britain towards tender offers that insures that all shareholders recieve equal treatment
he said he expected amendments ot the bill also would cover defensive mechanisms such as green mail and poison pills
proxmire said he intended to inrtoduce his bill later this month and predicted the senate committee would act this spring
he said he was hopeful congress could pass a bill this yaer

conable said the world bank has been pressing developing countries to open their markets arguing that a free trading environment increased teh possibility of global economic growth

the interview acme just before next week meetings of the bank and the international monetary fund
referring to brazil recent interest payments moratorium conable also said the global debt situation was very serious and umst be closely watched

he said the bank which in the past has concentrated on making loans that assist the basic underpinnings in the developing world such as dams roads and sewers will increasingly make assistance avaialble for economic reform

we comfortable with adjustment lending we expect however that ti will never reach a majority of our portfolio conable said

he noted the problem of debt was a severe one and many countries are asking for adjustment assistance because of the problem fo debt
conable is a a former republican congressman from new york chosne by president reagan for the bank position last year

conable laso said that he expected the result of a major study of the bank organization to be completed in the next several weeks

the reorganization is considered a major initiative by conable and is being by the agency 151 as an indication fo his management style and priorities
i want to be sure this institution is viewed by those who must support it as soundly constituted so thta it will be permitted to grow conable said
however he said i do believe there is anything basically wrong with this institution and i do believe it hsa to have any redefinition of its purpose
he said however that it was apparent that the debt initiative proposed by bakre has given the bank a central role in dealing with the debt crisis

conable added that cooperation between the bank and its sister agency the international monetary fund was good and that he talked often with imf managing director micehl camdessus on a variety of issues

on a personal level conable said that he not feel a need to put his personal stamp on the bank noting that i do have a particluar mission here except to be useful to the institution and to the process of development

hte securities and exchange commission reminded corporate raiders and others tendering for the shares of companies that they must extend the period their offers are open if key conditions are changed

specifically the agency said those making tender offers for companies stock must extend the offers fi they decide to eliminate conditions requiring a minimum number of shares to be tendered in order for the offers to be valid
tender offers typically include minimum shrae conditions
as a result a purchaser would not be bound to buy the shares that were tendered if the minimum level were not reachde

in an interpretation of current rules which officials said clarifies the sec present position the agency said a tender offer must be extenedd if a minimum share condition is waived even if the purchaser reserved the right to do so
the interpretation makes clear that waiving a minimum share condition is a material change of the tender offer under securities law sce officials said

the sec has already said that other specific material changes such as changes in the percentage of securities being sougth or the price being offered made during the course of a tender offer require a extension of the offer
the length of the extension which is aimed at giving shareholders an adequate chance to assess revisions of a tender offer was not specified in cases where the minmium share conditions were waived
sec officials said the length of the extension in such cases would depend on teh facts and circumstances surrounding each case but would generally be between five and 10 days
the agency cited two recent tender offers in which waivers of a minimum share conditios were tried on the last day of each offer denying shareholders the chance ot react to the new information
officials declined ot identify the two offers
if a bidder makes a material change near or at teh end of its offer it will have to extend the offer to permit adequate dissemination the sec said
federal securities law requires that all tender offers remain open fro at least 20 business days

scientists said some tropical vegetable oils can be hazardous to consumers whose health is at risk beacuse of high levels of saturated fat lending weight to a campaign by the american soybean association asa for labelling changes

the scientists appeared to support an asa charge denied by malaysian palm growers that imported coconut palm and palm kernel oils contain hihg levels of saturated fat and thus raise blood cholesterol and the risk of heart disease
in a petition filed in january the asa asked the food and drug administration fda to require palm palm kernel and coconut oisl to be identified as saturated fats on food manufacturers labels
the fda responded to the asa in a letter saying it wolud consider the petition as a comment to a proposed rule dealing with cholesterol and fatty acid labelling of foods

but steve chang professor of food science at rutgers university said paml oil is definitely not good for human health because it has a high content of saturated fatty acid
he added that the higher the fatty acid the greater the blood cholesterol levle
it has been well established that high cholesterol levels will have a higehr level of heart disease he said
a malaysian oil palm growers council official borge has said studies have shown that palm oil is low in saturated fats has properties and prevenst blood clotting and blocking of arteries in humans

said americans consume more saturated fats daily through food like butter bacon ham and beef than from palm oil which he added is rich in vitamins a and david kritchevsky associate director of the wistar institute in philadelphia appeared to take the asa view no labelling

the more a consumer knows the more likely he will make na intelligent choice
the scientists said they had no doubt imported palm palm kernel and cocnout oils contain high saturated fat levels
kritchevsky a specialist in nutrition said more saturated fat would raise cholesterol levles so from that point of view it a health risk
high cholesterol levels in the blood aer a risk factor for heart disease

four meat processors have aksed the federal government to relax a labelling requirement which they said discourages the use of mechanically separated meat the agriculture department said

the petition filed by bob evans farms odom sausage oc sara lee corp and owens country sausage asks usda to allow mechanically separated meat to be listed on product labels as the species from which it was derived
for example prok would be listed on the ingredients statement instead of mechanically separated pork

under the petition the calcium content of the meat product would have to be stated on the label and the mechanically separated meat could constitute no more than 10 ptc of the meat and poultry portion of the product
mechanically separated meat is a product that has been approved for use since 1978 usad said

current regulations allow use of mechanically separated ingredients at levels up to 20 pct of the meat and poultry product but require it to be listed in the ingredient statement as mechaniaclly separated species usda said
usda said the petitioning firms claimed companies avoid using mechanically separated meat in their products becuase the term carries an unwarranted negative connotation in the minds of many consumers
the petitioners also noted that no similar regulatoin exists for poultry products

thomas melzer st louis federal reserve bank president favored some tightenign of reserve conditions
he noted the strong growth in bank loans in november through january and the firm federal funds rate that had prevailed despiet the extraordinary pace of reserve growth
he also cited the recent decliens in the dollar value
finally looking ahead melzer pointed otu the potential for a further rise in inflationary expectations
he believed that prompt restraints mihgt avert the need for more substantial tightening later
regarding policy adjustments the fomc minutes showed the members generally felt that policy implementation should eb especially alert to the potential need for some firming of reserve conditions

in this view the fomc said somewhat greater reserve restraint would be warranted if monetary growth did not slow in line with current expectations and there were concurrent indications of intensiyfing inflationary pressures against the background of stronger economic data
one indication of potential price pressure might be a further tendency for the dollar to weakne
the minutes showed that one member presumably melzer preferred a directive thta did not contemplate any easing during the weeks ahead
however most of the members did not want to rule out the possibility of some slight easing during the period although they did nto view the conditions for such a move as likely to emerge

european community ec finance ministers and central bankers agreed on the need fro greater cooperation to strengthen the european monetary system ems against international market turbulence officials said

there was a general will to reinforce the european monetary system with all that implise belgian finance minister mark eyskens said yesterday after hosting a session of informal talks at this belgian coastal resort
the gathering was the first such discussion snice the second major realignment of ems parities within nine months in january

the system has come under severe strain as funds have flowed out of the slumping dollar adn into the dominant ems currency the west german mark sending it soaring against weaker currencies in the system

he told a news conference yesterday meeting agreed on the need for closer coordination among ems member governments of interest rate policies and fo interest rate differentials between different countries

but eyskens said this coordination raised a whole range of technical problems and ministers would discuss these further in luxembourg in june on the basis of proposals from the monetary committee and committee of central bank governors

bond trading is likely to remain cautious in the near term with a possible downward price bisa as market participants focus on trends in the dollar the economy and federal reserve policy economists said

west german abnking regulations must be expanded to cover sheet risks arising from new financing forms federal banking supervisory office president wolfgang kuntze said
kuntze told abnkers at a reception that deals for hedging price risks are not covered by current supervisory rules
such edals could be used for speculation and do not have to be disclosed
kuntze also said it must be considered whether banks can continue not to set sharehodlers equity and reserves against their own holdings of securities

since early 1984 banks have been limited to lending 18 times shareholders equity and reserves on a consolidated basis and bundesbank officials have said that interest rate and currency swasp and currency options are under scrutiny
authorities favour reinterpreting the banking law to fit present circumstances in order to avoid the long parliametnary political process of changing it banking sources said
kuntze said solutions to the problem of banking supervision can be found without having to change teh law again
the risk structure in banking is moving away from the model on which banking supervisory rules aer based kuntze said
banking supervisors rae still firemen with a safety net but the safety net has become a little too small he said
kuntze declined ot detail possible changes to banking regulations as these are still the subject of discussions between the supervisory office and the bundesbank
he said eh sees no chance in the foreseeable future for an international harmonisation of supervisory law and the german supervisory office would not wait for such harmonisation
nor would it get involved in international competition no minimal regulatory standards in order to shield banks from competitive disadvantages he said

the international cocoa organization icco buffer stock could face an uphill battle to halt the downtrend in world cocoa prices when it begins buiyng operations in the next few weeks cocoa traders said
rtaders said they believed buffer stock purchases could reach tonnes in a matter of weeks without lifting prices significantly given the amount of surplus cocoa overhanging the market
hte buffer stock may begin buying shortly as the icco 10 day average indicator price is now at special drawing rights sdr per tonne below the must buy level
urles governing buffer stock operations were agreed last month by the icco council
buying will begin once the buffer stock manager has completed preparations traders said

some traders said the buffer stock manager may delay buffer stock buying until mid or when changes in months used ot calculate the icco indicator may lift the 10 day average above the sdr must buy level
the icco indicator price is calculated from the average of teh second third and fourth positions on the london and new york futures markets
the daily price was sdr pre tonne yesterday
months used currently for the indicator are may july and september but these are set to change to july september and decemebr on april 15 prior to may becoming the new york spot month traders noted
hte introduction of december into the calculations may lift the daily sdr price as december is currently quoted about 75 stg above may on the london terminal market
ubt the buffer stock manager would have to wait for the higher daily price to feed through into the average the indicator which governs his activities traders said

the buffer stock manager is obviously looking at the implications of delaying until forward prices lift teh indicator since it might mean he has to buy less cocoa an analyst from a leading cocoa trade house said
traders said the buffer stcok purchases could reach tonnes fairly quickly once buying starts
if purchases reach this level within six months buiyng is suspended pending an icco council review of price ranges

but some cocoa market watchers said the buffer stock may benefit from recent forecasts for a poor brazilian bahia temporao crop at mln to two mln 60 kilo bags against initial expectations of up to three mnl
a lower than expected brazilian crop may cut the world surplus to between and tonnes compared with a recetn forecast by the icco statistics committee of tonnes traders said
in these circumstances the buffer stock may only need to buy between and tonnes to lift prices above teh must buy level
but some dealers said the icco buffer stock rules may put constraints on how quickly and effectively the buffer stock manager can remove cocoa frmo the market
the buffer stock system of price differentials set according to quality and a 15 pct limit on purchases from could limit the buffer stock scoep for action dealers said
most of the cocoa readily available to the buffer stcok is nearby material of malaysian and ivory coast origin

but the buffer stock can only buy 15 pct malaysian cocoa as malaysia is not an icco member while purcahses of nearby cocoa can only reach 40 pct in any one day which forces the buffer stock to buy some intermediate and forward shipment material
limits on buffer stock purchases of nearby and cocoa iwll reduce the impact on terminal prices which are pressured by the overhang of malaysian material traders said

buffer stock purchases of forward shipment occoa from quality producers such as ghana will have only a limited impact on futures but is likely to widen physical market premiums for this cocoa over futures
ghana premium to hte terminal has risen to about 50 stg from 25 to 30 stg a month ago partly in anticipation of buffer stock buying dealers said
the buffer stock may not help the terminal makret but will provide a backstop for quality cocoas one trader said
traders cautioned that views on the impact of teh buffer stock were all prognostication and that no one could hope to predict accurately what the result would be

psychologically buffer stock buying should help prices but since the buffer stock already holds a caryrover of tonnes from the previous cocoa agreement and the market is in surplus dealers expressed doubts purchases can counter bearish pressure

foreign banks in west germany are reassessing their positions after a number of changes in teh markets and the regulatory environment that have dampened a enthusiasm for expansion here

treasury secretary james baker holds talks with counterparts from europe adn japan today to urge them to carry out commitments in a recent accord to speed their economic growth
baker is also expected to outline proposals for making agreemenst to coordinate economic policies more binding
the bilateral discussions foreshadow talks of the group of five industrial countries joined later by italy and canada ot form the group of seven
the five comprise finance ministers and central bankers of the united states japan west germany france adn britain
the treasury secretary is expected to see japanese finance minister kiichi miyazawa west german finance minister gerhard stoltenberg and british chancellor of the exchequer ngiel lawson
baker and other finance miinsters say they intend to reaffirm the paris agreement to buttress global economic growth reduce trade imbalances and stabilize currencies
monetary sources said a short communique to that effect is expected after hte meeting ends
thees talks form part of this week meetings of the international monetary fund and the world bank
at the same time monetary sources say they expect baker to put forward proposals originally outlined at the 1986 tokoy summit to tighten procedures for policy coordination

washington wants other major nations to establish specific policy goals for economic growth inflation current account balance of payments traed balances budget performance monetary conditions and currencies
fi actual economic performance veers sharply away from such objectives then countries should consult on whether corrective action is necessary the proposal says

monetary osurces said there was some support for the proposal which may not be made final until the venice economic summit in june but britain and west germany were firmly against any attempt to make corrective action automatic
hte treasury team led by baker has worked on this plan since last september when it won the support of france
baker meanwhile will press japan and west germany to live up to their commitments made over six weeks ago ni paris to boost their domestic demand to absorb more imports
he is also expected to reassure his counterparts that the reagan administration will reach agreement with congress on a significatn budget deficit cut this year helping to depress demand for imports
the aim of the paris accord is to redress the huge imbalance between the trade surpluses of tokyo and bonn on the one hand adn washington massive trade deficit on the other
japan in particular is under pressure to come up with a meaningful stimulus package or face a further rise in the yne
financial markets appear to believe the yen should go higher against the dollar a development that has becoem unacceptable in japan
the paris agreement by the united states japan wets germany france britain and canada called for currencies to be stabilized around current levels
but the dollar fell again just several weeks after the agreement was reached and its present stability is said to be temporary as dealers await the outcoem of this week talks
meanwhile representatives of the leading third world countries contniue preparing their position for their ministers to present to industrial nations later this week
monetary sources said the group of 24 developing nations are preparing a very tough communique which brands the western strategy for shoring up the debt srtategy as a failure
they call instead for vast new assistance from the industrial world and a much greater role for the international monetary fund and the wolrd bank

colombia is in teh process of arranging two for projects in the electrical sector director of public credit mauricio cabrera said
he told journalists he expects an mln dlr loan to be by the development bank iadb to be completed by the middle of enxt month
he laso said talks have just concluded with the world bank on a 200 mln dlr and that discussions with the bankers will begin later this month
acbrera was here for the signing yesterday of a 50 mln dlr floating rate note

the floating rate onte was the first such issue for colombia which has had limited access to the international capital markets since the eruption of the international debt crisis in 1982 despite its ability to avoid a rescheduling
the iadb si for interconexion electrica sa isa a public electricity utility
the loan si for 10 years with four years grace
interest will be at cpt during the grace period after which the margin will rise to pct cabrera said
there is aslo a front end fee of one pct
the cost of the project totals mln dlrs of which isa will contribute about 100 mln and the iadb 115 mln eh added
fuji bank ltd and samuel montaug and co ltd are arranging the commercial bank portion of the financing
cabrera noted that only about 20 pct of the loan wlil be drawn this year
he said the world bank si likely to come to the market no earlier than june
it is part of na overall financing for various projects in the electrical sector that will take four years and cost about 300 mln dlrs a year
of the total cost eh expects the world bank and the iadb to contribute about 700 mln dlrs with the bank of japan lending between 200 and 300 mln
the blaance will come from commercial banks
cabrera said that colombia also plans one other issue in the internationla capital markets this year

the country expected to launch up to 120 mln dlrs in floating rate notes but the market has virtually disappeared in the past few months as supply outstripped demand and the number of market makers contractde sharply
cabrera said he is now considering several options including a fixed rate eurobond and an issue in japna
last year colombia arranged a private placement in japan for the equivaletn of about 40 mln dlrs
although it prefers a public issue colombia would place any finacning in japan privately
bankers noted that the floating rate note signed yesterday which was for seven years with four years grace and paid pct ovre libor was basically a disguised loan
cabrera said that as of december 31 1986 colombia had 11 billion dlrs of public sector foreign debt and billion dlrs fo private sector debt

federal reserve board chairman paul volcker said a futrher large drop in the value of the dollar could be counterproductive for world economic growth
testifying before the senate banking committee volcker said thta europe and japan were slowing exports and that growth in those countries was also decreasing
in that kind of situation further sizeable depreciation of the dollar could well be counterproductvie he said
domestic expansion in foreign industrial countries has not been enough to offset the effects fo slower exports volcker said
on the value of the dollar volcker said he could not say whether it sholud be higher or lower to restore balance in trade
what we do know is that a substantial exchange rate adjustmetn has already been made he said

that adjustment should be large enough in a context of a growing world economy and fiscal restraint in the united states to support the widespread expectations of a narrowing in the real trade deficit in the period aheda he said
volcker said exports were now growing substantially while import growht should slow
volcker said that to improve the trade dfeicit with a minimum of inflationary pressure the united states would have to slow its spending growth
it would also have to achieve a bteter balance between investment and domestic savings if it wants to be able to dispense with foreign capital
the constructive way to work in the needed direction would be to reduce our budget deficit year by year paving the way for improvements in our trade accounts he said
relying on depreciation fo the dollar alone would risk renewed inflation he said

federal reserve board chairman paul volcker said htat debtor nations have made much progress in laying the groundwork for economic growth but a solution to world debt difficulties was endangered by inaction on new financing

brazil has the potential for beocming a leading world economic power but it is in a difficult position today volcker said
he said ti will take a concerted effort to regularize brazil external payments
the key prreequisite is clearly in the hands of brazilian authorities he said
both brazil and its creditors have a strong incentive to work otgether volcker said
regarding trade imbalances volcker said that it was critically important that markets be kept open by teh industrial nations
