bundesbank council member lothar mueller said the bank has not given up its money suplpy policy and that restraining money supply growth does not always mean pushing up interest rates

mueller said in an article for the boersen zeitung financial daily that a monetary policy which toko into account exchange rate expectations and capital flows could not be confused with an exchange rate oriented policy
the article followed international press speculation that the bundsebank had abandoned money supply targetting in favour of an exchange rate policy

mueller a member of the bundesbank council in his position as president of the regoinal state central bank in bavaria noted that the bundesbank decision in january to cut leading interest rates amid continuing strong monetary growth had led some people to think it was dropping monetary targetting
simply to ignore the external economic context wuold be risky and dangerous for monetary policy he explained
mueller said the cuts in official interest rates had put an end to interets rate speculation
the bundesbank could now assume that upward pressure on the mark would ease and currency inflows slwo down
lower money market rates achieved by widening short and long term interest rate differentials also encouraged investors to funds parked in liqudi accounts mueller said
the measures therefore aimed clearly at bringing monetary growth back onto the desired paht he said
finally of course nad there is no need to keep this quiet the cut in interest rates was also in line with the changed economic situation of the last few months he added
all ni all the bundesbank in no way abandoned its money supply policy with the january discount rate cut despite suppositions to the contrary mueller said

keeping money supply developments in check is not always synonymous with raising interest rates especially when excessive liquidity due to inlfows from abroad rather than growth in bank credits is the cause of rising monetary holdings of mueller said
now that west germany no longer ran large external deficits otehr concepts were needed for monetary policy
mueller said it would be both difficult and dangerous for monetray policy to pursue a specific exchange rate
in any case the exchange rate partly depends on currency and budgeatry policy and the economy he said

but an exchange rate orientation would also mean the end of a strict stability policy because both interest rates and liquidity would be affecetd by required currency intervention and could no longer be steered autonomously by the bundesbank
even interest rates are not in the centre of the bundesbank considerations but reflect competition and other market conditions muellre said
a cut in bank liquidity will not directly influence central bank money stokc the bundesbank main money supply indicator
this does not reflect banking liquidity but the liquidity of industry and households which can not be directly reached with the bundesbank instruments mueller sadi
the less dependent are on bank credits the harder it is to stere money supply
this has increasingly been the case recently because have received considerable sums from current account surplusse and capital imports

if the bundesbank had tried to brake the money supply rise with higher interest rates as would have been appropriate if credit was growing excessively it would not only have misesd its target but probably even set off further inflows he said
mueller said growth in money supply was still too high
ni the last three months money stock grew at an annual rate of seven pct down from 10 pct in the previous quarter
the rgowth curve has therefore come closer to the three to six pct 1987 target corridor for central bank money stock growth pointing to the success of the current policy he said
ubt high monetary stocks can be a warning sign and there should be no change in priorities
monetary policy must be first and foremost stability policy and successful stability policy is money supply policy nothing eles he said

assistant rteasury secretary david mulford said he prefers debt conversion plans to help heavily indebted countries over political plans to help ease their debt burden

in my ivew debt conversions or swaps into either equity or local debt claims provide a preferable route to relief for the debtor nations particularly if combined with measures to encourage new equity investment and the repatriation of flight capital he told the house subcommittee on international development institutions
mulford criticized hwat he called solutions to the debt problems effecting many developing countries ranging from debt forgiveness to creating new multilateral institutions for lending

he said debt conversions or wsaps are more effective because they eliminate the interest service on converted debt create new jobs and open up investment opportunities that can help indebted countries overcome their own problems

the bank of england proposed that bnaks in britain for the first time will have to seek authorization to be lead underwriters of new issues in the euromarkets
in addition the bank has proposed lmiits on the amount of credit risk that firms can take on with each new issue they lead manage
the proposed rules were outlined today ni a consultative paper on large credit exposures taken by recognized banks and deposit takers and may be modified the bank said
the rules could affect billions of dollars of eurobond securities issued each year
in 9186 about 183 billion dlrs of new eurobonds were offered according to figures compiled by euromoney magazine
pu until now there have been no restrictions on lead managing eurobond issues
however uerobond market participants believe the bank of england is concerned about intense competition for market share which may have caused some firms to expose themselves to imprudent credit risk
competition for market share has been a boon to issuers as banks compete to offer teh best terms
but the new rules suggest that some constraints may be placed on competition as regulators attempt to ensure that no bakn takes on more risk than it can handle
banking sources said that while the bank of england is reluctant to inhibit competition it is willing to accept some constrainst in order to ensure that underwriters act prudently

the bank assessment of the appropriateness of a lead underwriting activity will depend primarily uopn the skill and experience of the lead underwriter in the particular market concerned the bank proposal said
once a firm has received permission to cat as lead underwriter the exposure will be valued at of the face amount of the securities
nominal exposure exceeding 60 pct of capital msut be reported to the bank of england and it must be notified in advance for exposure of over 150 pct of capital
the exposure will be determined to exist ofr a maximum of 28 days following a binding commitment to underwrite
after that any remaining exposure from unsold securities will be assessed at theri full face value
the rules would not apply to syndicated loan facilities revolving credits or commercila paper the bank said

the bank also amended other aspects of plans to strengthen its supervisory powers over banks in the paper which called for comments from professionals by march 31 to allow their possible inclusion in the banking bill ni time for its planned final discussion in parliament scheduled before summer
the new banking bill updating the 1979 banking act is the third leg of the conservative government legislation for the supervision of finacnial institutions
it is to feature alongside the financial services act aimed to bolster investor protection and the building societies act which put these institutiosn on an equal footing with banks
the proposed legislation would abolish distinctions between recognised banks and licensed and tighten legal controls making it a criminal offence to mislead supervisosr

proposals to require banks to inform the bank of england in advance of planned exposures in excess of 25 pct of their capital and to haev the bank supervise exposures between 10 and 25 pct of capital were not under debate the paper showed
however preliminary consultations with bank representatives had shown some of the initial proposlas to be flawed it said
most proposed changes involved evaluating exposures on a basis rather than along general linse
amendments nivolved the bank proposed treatment of exposures by financial institutions acting as banker to other units of their own group of companies the paper showed
they laso regarded the treatment of credit exposure to local governments and other public sector entities and of exposures undertaken by banks that are subsidiaries of banks
proposals no how to value securities given by a debtor as collateral to a credit were slightly changed the paper showed
exposures taken on by banks acting as creditor within their own group of companies would usually be looked into on a bassi under new proposals it said

the paper said exposures to industries and other public sector authorities in the and abroad should be given the more lenient treatment of credits to governments provided a government gives unconditional repaymetn guarantees
it cautioned that exposures to local authorities and those guarnateed by the british export credit guarantee department would probably not qualify for such treatment
on credits granted by banks which are a subsidiary fo another bank an 100 pct of capital ceiling could be exceeded in individual cases

but the parent bank would have to give a formal undertaking to take over the exposure if problems weer to occur and state in writing that the exposure was retained in the balance sheet to meet precise group objectives the paper said
on collateral security it said this should normally onyl be taken into account when considering the acceptability of a bank exposure up to 25 pct of its capital base

the presence of security taken on its own will be considered by the bank as an accetpable reason for an exposure in excess of 25 pct but only in the most exceptional circumstances and even then to a very limited extent it said

soviet winter grains could be off to a faulty start this spring after enduring an usually dry fall and cold winter weather and crop analysts sadi
prospects for another grain harvest in the soviet union appear dim at this point but it is premature to forecast any major crop problems anlaysts said
but the situation bears careful watching over the next six weeks and will ultimately impact the soviet grain supply and future buying plans analysts of the svoiet union said
from a weather standpoint you can say with certainty that hte soviets are not getting off to a good start and will have a lower crop than last year gail martell chief meteorologist for hutton said
the next six weeks in the ussr grain growing areas will be teh crucial period that will determine the final outcome of the winter crops martell and other analysts said
where the crop is really made or broken is still ahead of su an agriculture department authority on the ussr said
the soviet union recently reported that nine mln hectares of winter grain will have to be reseeded due to winterkill
this would be equal to about 25 pct of the total winter crpo and would be the second highest winterkill in ten years the usda analyst said

with a timely spring soviet farmers would probably be able to reseed the damaged acreage with spring crops but analysts noted that spring crops normalyl yield lower than winter crops sometimes as much as pct lower
normally winterkill is caused by inadequate snowcover combined with codl temperatures

this winter however snowcover in soviet grain areas has generally been excellent so the bulk of winterkill analysts speculate likely has been due to a very dry fall and subsequent poro crop germination
fall dryness may eb a problem
there a good correlation between mediocre crops adn fall dryness martell said
precipitation last fall was as little as 25 pct of normal in southern and northern ukraine and below normal over the entire winter crop area she sadi
recent cold temperatures in grain areas in which the snowcover has been gradually melting could also have caused problems of and winterkill jim candor senior forecaster for accu wetaher said
livestock feed needs have probbaly increased because of the fall and winter analysts said
the dry fall damaged pastures the cold winter raised fede demands and a late spring would require longer feeding they said
the soviets are not in a desperate situation they do have to buy grains now a usda officila said

but if the soviets are worried about their winter crops and if they feel that last year huge crop of 210 mln tonnes was a fluke brought on by perfect conditions more soviet buying might occru to insure crop supplies he said
bad weather during the next six weeks could push the soviets back into the market weather analysts sadi
a lot of winetrkill could occur during the next month and a half martell said

coffee prices may have to fall even lower to bring exporting and importing countries once more round the negotiating table to discuss export quotas ioc delegates and traders said

the failure last night of international coffee organization ico producing and consuming countries to agree export quotas brought a sharp fall on international coffee futures markets today with the london may price reaching a year low at one stage of stg per tonne before ending the day at stg down 184 stg from the previous clsoe

pressure will now build up on producers returning from the ico talks to sell coffee which hda been held back in the hope the negotiations would establish quotas which would put a floor under prices some senior traders said
the ico 15 day average price stood at cents a lb fro march 2

this compares with a target range of 120 to 140 cents a lb under the system operating before quotas were suspended in february last year following a sharp rise in international prices caused by drought damaeg to the brazilian crop
in a reuter interview brazilian coffee institute ibc president jorio dauster urged producers not to panic and said they need to make ahrd commercial decisions
if we have failed at the ico at least we have tried dauster said adding now it is time to go and sell coffee
btu brazil is keeping its marketing options open
it plans to make an official estimate of the forthcoming crop enxt month dauster said
it is too difficult to ofrecast now
trade sources have put the crop at over 26 mln bags compared with a previosu crop of mln
brazil is defining details of public selling tenders for coffee bought on london futures marekt last year
a basic condition will be that it does not go back to the market ni one go but is sold over a minimum of six months
the breakdown of the ico negotiations reflected a split between producers and consumers on hwo to set the yardstick for future quotas
consumers said objective criteria like average exports and stcoks should determine producer quota shares dauster said

all elements of this proposal were open to negotiation but consumers insisted they did nto want a return to the ad hoc way of settling export quotas by virtual horse trading amongst producers whilst consumers waited in the corridors of the ico

dauster said stocks and exports to ico members and all need to be considered wehn setting quotas and that brazil would like to apply the coffee pact with a set ratio of overall quota reflecting stock holdings
it is a simplistic misconception that brazil can dictate policy to ohter producers
while consumer countries are welcome to participate they can not dictate quotas which are very difficult to allocate as different objective criteria acheive different of quota dauster said
other delegates said there was more open talking at the ico and ta least differences were not hidden by a bad compromise
consumer delegates said they had not been prepared to accept the producers offre to abandon quotas if it proves impossible to find an acceptable basis for them
we want the basis of quotas to reflect availability and to encourage stock holding as an alternative to a buffer stock if supplies are neeedd at a later stage one delegate said

some consumers claimed producer support for the consumer argument was gaining momentum towards the end of the ico session but said it is uncertain whether this will now collapse and how muhc producers will sink their differences should prices fall further and remain depressed
the ico executive board meets here march 30 to april 1 but both producer and consumre delegates said they doubt if real negotiations will begin then
the board is due to meet in indonesia in june with a full council scheduled fro september
more cynical traders said the pressure of mraket forces and politics in debt heavy latin american producer countries could bring ico members back around the negotiating table sooner than many imagine
in that case qoutas could come into force during the summer
but most delegates and traders said quotas bfeore october are unlikely while brazil dauster noted the ico has continued although there were no quotas from 1972 to 1980

a clear difference between the pressures already being felt by importers and exporters was that consumers would have been happy to agree on a formula for future quotas even if it coudl not be imposed now
at least in that way they said they could show a direct relationship between quotas adn availability
in contrast producers wanted quotas to plug the seemingly bottomless market and were prepared to allwo these to lapse should lasting agreement not be found
producers ewre offering us jam tomorrow but after their failure to discuss them last year promises were insufficient and we wanted a cast iron commitment now one consumer said

the international swap dealers association has developed the first standard form contrcat for use by arrangers of currency and interest rate swap transactions said thomas jasper the
the contract unveiled at a press conference is expected to make the 300 billion dlr a year swpa market more efficient he said
the contracts wil accelerate the process and reduce teh expense of swap documentation japsper said
privately eurobond traders estimate that about 80 pct of all new issues eventually become part of either na interest rate or currency swap
an interest rate swap occurs when two issuers usually acting through a bank middleman agree to accept eahc interest payments on debt securities
usually the issuer fo a floating rate debt security swaps into debt and vice versa
but the obligation ofr repayment of the debt remains with the original borrower

bank regulators have become concerned about the use of swaps because the middleman usually a bank takes on some portion of the risk but is not required to show it on the balance sheet as a liability and may not have sufficient capital ot cushion it

kenneth mccormick a of the isda and president of kleinwort benson cross financing inc said the bank of england and the federal reserve board were expected later today to announce joint proposals for setting minimum capital standards fro counterparties in swaps
the standards are part of the recently announced convergence agreement between the two countries in which regulators have attempted to set similra capital requirements for institutions
mccormick told reporters the isda was concerned that a level playing field be maintained ni the swaps market
he said if and banks were required to hold more primary capital against swap transacitons than is the current practice the additional costs would have to be passed on to issuers
the issuers might then choose to do business with banks which are not subejct to or banking rules
he said the isda had been working on a code of conduct for swpa dealers as part of its effort

the bundesbank is planning changes in the system by which banks bid for funds in securities repurchase pacts to improve the flexibility of ist key open market instrument central bank officials said

banking economists asid the changes will shorten the tender process to two days from three currently enabling the bundesbank to offer repurchase pacts of shorter maturity if it chooses to steer money market liquidity more flexibly
hte changes will probably come into force in april
under hte current system banks must themselves specify at the tender which securities they will sell to the bundesbank for subsequent repurchase a time consuming business
banks hold securities for this purpose in safe custody accounts in the landeszentralbank lzb regional central banks which are the local offices of the bundsebank at state level
some 50 billion marks of securities are held in suhc accounts at the hesse lzb which covers the frankfurt area
the change to come into force next month will allow the bundesbank access to these accounts to select the bonds itself in a process legally comparable to direct debiitng
at present the bundesbank generally announces a tender on monday holds the tender late on tuesday morning announces the result early tuesday afternoon adn allocates funds wednesday
the bundesbank generally sets repurchase patcs running 28 days
but sometimes public holidays result in longer pacts or longer tender periosd being necessary
for instance the bundesbank announced a tender last friday to eb held today wednesday for crediting funds tomorrow thursday
the advance announcement took into account the carnival holiday in duessledorf on monday and in frankfurt yesterday tuesday
central bank officials and money market dealers said the shortening fo the tender process should be seen as purely technical with no direct implications for interest rates
it is ont a credit policy matter but a technical matter said an official at the hesse lzb

bundesbank president karl otto opehl said last december that security repurchase pacts had proved a much greater success since their introduction in their present form two years ago and praised their flexibility
the tender process changes will make the repurchase pact instrument even more flexible bankign economists said

by speeding up the tender process they will make it possible for the bundesbank to offer repurchase pacts for periods of less than a month something long sougth by banks to respond to changing money market conditions
with the help of this instrument liquidity steering will be refined but there wo be any effect on interest rates sadi berliner und frankfurter bank economist hermann remsperger
the bundesbank would be able ot react more quickly to money market developments but by steering liquidity not interest rates he said

the federal reserve board voted unanimously to propose a formula for calculating the risk of interest rate and currency swaps as part of its ongoing effort to come up with a new capital standard for banks that takes into acconut the riskiness of a bank loans and other assets
fed officials said an identical proposal was being issues todya by the bank of england
the efd set a period for public comment on the plan
the proposal adopted otday addresses only the credit risks associated with interest rate swaps forward foreign exchange contracts and similar financial instruments

previously the fed 8 proposed a series of guidelines for calculating the risk of other activities that banks would eb required to take into account in calculating the minimum financial cushion they would need to maintain
both guidelines set five broad categories of risk for lonas and other bank assets and assigned to each a level of risk that would establish a bank minimum capital needs
the additional guidelines proposed today would determine the amount fo capital support required for a bank current exposure for a given asset and the potential future exposure
the current exposure would be measured by the value of the asset which would reflect teh replacement cost
potential future increases in the replacement cost would be calculated using credit conversion factors based no statistical analyses by the staffs of the bank of england and banking regulators
future exposure would rise over the life fo the asset
the fed staff said the risk gauge attempted to balance conflicting needs for precision and simplictiy
they ignore ofr example the relative volatility of the particular currencies involved in exchange rate contracts
board officials asid the new gauge could increase the capital required of the largest money center banks which are the principal participants in these types of activities
they cautioned hte fed board to take account of the potential impact of the plan on the ability of banks to compete in world financial markets
however the staff concluded hte credit risks inherent in such contracts now constitute a significant element of the risk profiles of some banking organizations
the fed proposal would eexmpt all but the largest participants in this market on grounds the benefits of including the smaller banks would be outweighed by costs
also excluded wuold be interest rate and foreign exchange contracts traded on organized exchanges
governor martha seger said she was concerned that japan was not involved in the effort to draft new capital rulse

the 350 mln ecu package of social and structural measures agreed early today by european community farm ministers features a plan to compensate farmers for reducing output of certain surlpus products ec commission sources said
the ministers agreed that under this extensification scheme farmers would qualify for compensation if thye cut output of specific products by at least 20 pct
the plan would initially apply to cereals befe veal and wine they added
cereals farmers would have to achieve their output cuts by reducing acreage while cattle faremrs would reduce their number of head and vinegrowers would cut yield
in each case farmers would have to undertake not to step up their capacity for output of othre products which are in surplus in the ec
the sources said payment levels have not yet been fixed but will be designed to compensate farmers fro loss of profit on the production they forego
the sources said the package also contains provisions for payments to farmers who embark on a program aimde at protecting or improving the environment
it would also mean compensatory allowances in lses favoured farming areas would be extended to crops
at present such allwoances are available only for livestock
the package would provide 20 mln ecus ofr research into alternative farming techniques the sources added

at a news conference ec farm commissioner frans andriessen said the commission is also wroking on proposals to enable the ec and member states to provide direct income supports for relatively poor farmers
andriessen did not give full details but said member state aid would be subject ot strict criteria to avoid distortion of competition
ec payments would aim to help farmers to survive a difficult period while the ce tackles the problems of surplus production
the commission withdrew from the package agreed last night proposals to pay early retirement pensiosn to farmers aged 55 or over who gave up production
those who took their land completely out of farm production rather than passing it on to their heirs would have received more generous paymnets
andriessen said the commission plans to present revised proposals alnog these lines in an effort to get a scheme agreed

the bank of england and the federal reserve board have agreed new proposals for joint standards to measure the riks of an array of credit exposures that do not show up in bank balance sheets the bank of england said

the plan covering swaps forward contracts and options involving interest or exchange rates complements proposals agreed in january between the tow central banks to make commercial banks in the and britain subject to similar standards for measuring capital adequacy the proposal said
it said no final decisions had been reached yet and bakns have until april 16 to comment on the trunk proposals
the bank of england and fde said they had faced a dilemma

on the one hand we are determined to require adequate capital support for potential ftuure exposure on the other hand we are concerned that overly stringent capital requirements might unnecessarily affect the ability of and banking organisations to price contracts competitively

at the basis of the new proposals lies the concept of the credit equivalent aomunt the current value of a currency or interest rate contract and an estimate of its potential change in value due to currency or interest rate fluctuations until the contract matures

in treatment similar to that agreed in january for balance sheet assets the credit equivalent will be assigned one of five risk weights between zero and 100 pct depending no the quality of the counterparty the remaining maturity of the contract and on collaterals or guarantees to the contract the plans showed
the proposal showed that collaterals and guarantees would not be recognised in calculating credit equivalnet amounts
they would however be reflected in the assignmnet of risk weights
the only guarantees recognised are those given yb and
governments or in hte by domestic national government agencies the proposals showed
the paper said the proposed rules would ont cover spot foreign exchange contracts and securities traded in futures and options exchanges

it said regulatory authorities and the bank of england were keen to encourage banks to ent contracts consolidate multiple contracts with the same counterparty into one single agreement to create one single payments stream

it recognised that such arrangements may in certain circumstances reduce credit risk and wsih to encourage their further development and implementation and said some of the current proposals may be changed to take this into account
the paper said the proposed rules wuold not cover spot foreign exchange contracts and securities traded in futures and options exchanges

it said regulatory authorities and the bank of england were keen to encourage bnaks to net contracts consolidate multiple contracts with the same counterparty into one single agreement to create one single payments stream

failure of talks on international coffee organization ico coffee quotas last week may put political pressure on the united states particularly the state department to reassess its position but the si unlikely to back away from its basic demand quotas be set by objective criteria officials said

jon rosenbaum assistant trade representative and head of washington delegation to the tlaks told reuters on his return from london that the united states is willing to resume the coffee negotiations as early as april if necessary

rosenbaum said the united states will be flexible in discussing the method fo establishing objective criteria and any transition to new quotas but not on the basic aim of establishing an objective method of setting quotas

at the ico talks major consuming nations led by hte proposed that future coffee export quota shares be calculated by a formula incorporating a producer recent exportable production and verified stocks while large producers led by brazil proposed maintaining the traditional ad hoc division of shares
the consumer position would hvae in effect reduced the market share of brazil by far the world largest producer

rosenbaum said the administration would continue to support legislation now before congress which would allow the customs service to monitor coffee imports as a way to comply with ayn future coffee quotas
he said the reagan administration would be reviewing the coffee policy situation following the collapes of the london talks but nobody is proposing we change our position

however other government officials involved in coffee policy said they are bracing for a diplomatic and coffee markte offensive from producer countries led by brazil and colombia to soften the consumer position
knowing that its next crop is fairly large brazil will kind of want to test the resolve of othre producers and consumers said one official

the official who asked not to be identified said brazil and colombia amy flood the coffee market in the next few months in an effort to drive down prices and pressure other countries particularly the splinter group of small producers who differed with the major producers in london

this in turn could lead to urgent appeals from latin american countries fcaed with mounting debt problems to the state department and to the national security council in the white house for an easing of the position officials said
the state department a major player in setting coffee policy may then face conflicting pressures particularly from allies in central america officials sadi
el salvador and guatemala both backed brazil and colombia at the london talks ni resisting pressures for quotas based on objective criteria
but the dominican republic and costa rica joined the splinter group which said ti would agree to objective criteria

there is a strong feeling among some in the satte department that the united states should continue to support the splinter group of producers who have taken the step of opposing brazil on the objective criteria question officials said
within the consuming countries there also is expected to be some pressure to resasess positions
in london the was supported by the the netherlands west germany jaapn australia and new zealand on the issue of objective criteria officials said
this bloc represented enough votes among consuming nations to successfully prevent adoptoin of the producer proposals
however sources said west germany support was at times qualified and there is some concern that the european community could come under pressrue to be more accommodative to producers in future talks
france backed the ivory coast and other african producers during teh talks
a softening of the ec stance would make it more difficult although not impossible for teh to block producer plans
while political manuevering by small producers and consuming countries will be important officials said the kye to any future outcome will be brazil position
officials blamed brazil intransigence for the failure of the talks and said a more flexible positino from brasilia would be the most important step toward agreement

turkey expects a 1986 balance of payments deficit of billion dlrs well over target but is taking steps to improve its performance in this and other fields ail tigrel director of economic planning at the state planning organisation said
he told reuters the shortfall was a direct consequence of economic growth of nearly eight pct pu from pct in 1985 which he said resulted mostly from a surge in domestic demand
tigrel acknowledged a need to cut inflation further afetr a drop of more than 12 points to pct in the treasury wholesale index last year
this year target of 20 pct might be attaniable but the economic management will have to be careful he said

tigrel whose department produces the annual programme which is central to the govrenment economic planning said turkey creditworthiness was at risk over the current account shortfall originally targeted at 695 mln dlrs
we must alleviate the current account subtsantially to sustain the creditworthiness that we have managed to secure over the last five years he added

his comment echoed last october organisation ofr economic cooperation and development report on turkey which said ankara case for more financing on better terms would look better if inflation were lower and the current account deficit cut or turned into a surplus

in 1987 we must reduce the arte of growth in public sector investments we must reduce the public sector deficit as a percentage of gnp and we must achieve a very visible improvement in the current account deficit he said
tigrel said a usrge in public sector spending last year was also to blame for the high deficits
appropriations to government departments had been cut by eight pct since the budget was passed in december and foreign borrowing by municipalities hda been restrained
we are trying amke sure that public bodies stick to the investment programme and do not exceed their appropriations he said
it was hoped to bring the public sector borrowing requirement down to five pct of gnp in 1987 from an estimated pct ni 1986
more modest gnp growth of fiev pct for 1987 was also targeted tigrel said
measures were being taken to encouarge exports and production incentives were being considered
we must try to make sure that more capacity is injected inot the turkish economy in the coming years
the promotion policy is geared to make sure that both foreign investment and local private captial come more into play as far as manufacturing capacity is concerned tigrel said
he said the process of structural adjustment of the turkish economy to free market policies begnu in 1980 was still under way

trade had been liberalised and a freer exchange rate policy applied but he acknowledged there was more to be done in a conutry where the state still dominates industry and the currency is only partially convertible

record ihgh borrowing of 376 billion dlrs in 1986 on international capital markets was supported by a large volume of debt refinancing and growing integration between national and international markets the oecd said

teh organisation for economic cooperation and development oecd said in its latest financial market trends report the 34 pct rise over 1985 volume was accompanied by major changes in the relative importance of the instruments used in international financing
straight bond offerings equity related securities and paper programmes as a share in total financing rose to their highest level this decaed
the markets for notes and for note issuance facilitise declined

the oecd said another striking feature of international capital markets in 1986 was the unprecedented concentration of lending to the oecd group of western industrialised countries which accounted for 90 pct of totla borrowing
factors behind the heightened pace of activity included a notable decline in interest rates which boosted borrowign through the flotation of securities
htis in turn was stimulated by growing familiarity with new techniques such as interest rate and currency swaps
stockmarkte buoyancy supported the expansion of bond issues and favoured the expansion of a rapidly expanding market for
a slowdown in net demand for funds by sovereign borrowers was more than offset by a large volume of refinancing operations inducde by improved market conditions and stronger debt management policies
growing integration with national markets meant the arrivla of a large number of new players on international markets
it added the development of a market for made committee and issuance facilities an increasingly popular alternative to traditional forms fo bank lending
turning to 1987 the oecd pointed to indications of a possible slowdown of international markets expansion and possibly less easy borrowing terms in a numbre of market areas
it said many market participants saw little scope for a further decline in rates and anticipate a slowdown in the pace of acitvity in the months ahead
it saw little reason for a turnaround in the declien in demand of recent years although it was likely more borrowers would try to make use of opportunities provided by the market for paper

it remains to be seen however to what extent the ecp market will be ready to absorb a significant volume of paepr from borrowers the report said adding that any major advance in the market absorptive capacity would require a significantly broader investor base

the economy is facing several serious problems whihc threaten its continued expansion according to a congressional report released today
the report by the democratic majority of the congressional joint economic committee said the outlook was for sluggish growth ni the and the rest of the world for the near future

they said pressures on the dollar might make it difficult for the federal reserve to use monetary policy ot stimulate the economy if this becomes necessary

there si now substantial concern about the inflationary effects of a declining dollar and the buildup of monetary pressure arising from the recent rapid growth in the money supply the democrat report said

at hte same time the increased reliance on foreign sources of capital in american investment markets means that the federal reserve can no longer be as aggressive as in the past in lowering interest rates and driving the dollar down
taken together the outlook for fiscal nad monetary policy is thus not very encouraging the democrats said
the democrats called on the administration to be more aggressive in removing foreign trade barriers and in seeking new initiatives to solve the international debt problme
the democrats said much of the trade deficit had been caused by misalignment of the world currencies especially the overvaluation of the dollar that began ni 1982

iran is in the driver seat in an absolute sense as the cycle of attack and retaliation continues said fred axelgard a gufl war expert with the private center for strategic and international studies csis
it like a greek tragedy said retired eugene carroll of washington prviate center for defense information cdi think tank
some middle east experts say the only way out is for washignton to join forces with moscow in pressing for an end to the war between iran and iraq
they say ti is not feasible for america to withdraw its force from the gulf area where the navy began escorting kuwaiti tankers in july
withdrawal would igve the appearance of being chased away by iran which president reagan could never accept

rianians manning the platform were warned in advance and allowed to escape
we do not seek further confrontation with iran but we will eb prepared to meet any escalation of military action by iran with stronger countermeasures weinberger said
we consider thsi matter closed he said
analysts ranging from the liberal cdi to conservatives agreed the reaction wsa measured reasonable and did not escalate the conflict unduly
but they said the quesiton was whether iran would consider the matter closed
it had not taken thsi view after earlier clashes

the swiss banking commission hopes to introduce a major reform of the banking system in january which would revolutionise the worknigs of the country unusual liquidity requirements

by effectively reducing liquidity requirements it would also help swiss banks compete better against those in britain west germany and the united statse he said
the commission wants to move to a system of average liquidity requirements wehre banks have to hold reserves equivalent to a certain proportion of their exposure calculated over the month as a whole
the current system described as a swiss special case by hauri forces banks to comply with requirements generalyl only at the end of each month

the result is a sharp upward trend in short dated money market rates overshadowed by the approach of the called the ultimo with consequent high costs for the banks who are forced to borrow extar funds from the national bank
this was particularly pronounced in june 1986 when overnight rates hti triple figures due to a combination of the end and a rigid adherence by the national bank to its money supply target
although the rise shocked the bank into more flexibility teh problem remained

the louvre accord on currency stability which has maintained an uneasy calm in currency markets since last february appeared in serious danger today as a transatlantic dispute over west german interest ratse came to the boil foreign exchange dealers said

but as the dollar slid against the mark and world stock and bond markets plunged officials in the major industrial countries played down the dispute as a bilateral problem between the unietd states and west germany and insisted that the currency pact was still alive
treasury secretary james baker sparked the market fears when he attacked the rise in west german interest ratse
that not in keeping with the spirit of what we agreed to as recently as earlier this month in washingtno baker said in a television interview on sunday
he was referring to the meetings of finance ministers from the group of seven g7 leading industrial nations which reaffirmde the pact
under the louvre accord west germany and japan who both have large trade surpluses pledged to boots their economic growth to take in more exports from the while the
agreed to stop talking teh dollar down
however baker said on saturday that while the louvre agreement was still operative the west german niterest rate move would force the to the accord
the ofreign exchange market has been told by baker that he going to hammer germany
he has ujst declared all bets are off in terms of currency cooperation chris johns currency analyst at and drew in london said

but a bank of japan official took a much more sanguine view telling reuters that the exchange market is apparently reacting too much and anyone who sold the dollar on the baker comment will regret it latre on
french finance minister edouard balladur who hosted the louvre meeting was the only one of the g7 finance mniisters to respond directly to baker remarks
he called for a faithful and firm adherence by all the major industrial countries to the louvre accords ni both their letter and spirit
neither the west german finance ministry nor the british treasury commetned on the row
but a japanese finance ministry officail said that despite
frustration over higher interest rates abroad this does not represent its readiness to scrap the basic framework of the louvre accodr
in frankfurt wilhelm christians joint chief executive of west germany largest bank deutsche bank sadi that following recent meetings with baker he believed that the was still committed to the accord
